alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 4:16PM MDT until July 15 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 416 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sugarite Canyon State Park, or 7 miles northeast of Raton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Raton, Raton Pass, Sugarite and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 450 and 460. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 350 and 365, and between Mile Markers 367 and 368. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Heavy rains from severe thunderstorms can produce sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos, ditches and over low water crossings. Do not attempt to drive through areas where water covers the roadway.
